channel.title: /var/run/tor/log AppArmor help needed
channel.description:
Could you add.
[code]Log notice file /var/run/tor/log[/code]
To /etc/tor/torrc please? Then restart Tor?
AppArmor complains about missing mknod (c) access to /run/tor/log. And I failed to find out how to add an exception to /etc/apparmor.d/local/system_tor. Maybe you can help out?
Background: We can keep /var/log/tor/log to have a log that survives reboot. An additional (multiple instances of the "Log" command seem to be supported by Tor) /var/run/tor/log that only contains messages since last boot would be helpful as well. whonxicheck could grep it for clock related messages and warn if it found something.

item.description:
No, I forgot that. Didn’t know it’s not required, since the init script is starting it with AppArmor.

Implemented:

github.com/Whonix/anon-gw-anonymizer-config

Added extra log file /run/tor/log that won't survive reboot. (Existing log file /var/log/tor/log that survives reboot will continue to exist.) And added necessary AppArmor rules. Thanks to @troubadoour who figured out the AppArmor rules (https://www.whonix.org/forum/index.php/topic,372.0/topicseen.html). This is useful, so whonixcheck can grep the log for clock specific warnings.

item.title: /var/run/tor/log AppArmor help needed
item.dc:creator: troubadour
item.description:
The updates /etc/apparmor.d/system_tor

# vim:syntax=apparmor
#include <tunables/global>

profile system_tor {
  #include <abstractions/tor>

  owner /var/lib/tor/** rwk,
  owner /var/log/tor/* w,

  /run/tor r,
  /run/tor/* rwk,

  # Site-specific additions and overrides. See local/README for details.
  #include <local/system_tor>
}

We cannot uses /var/run because it is a symlink to a directory.

Had to add the loc(k) mask too.

item.title: /var/run/tor/log AppArmor help needed
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
I was indeed testing in Whonix 9.

Tor’s AppArmor profile works differently. There is no global profile. It’s load by /etc/init.d/tor. At release time of Whonix 8 there was a bug in AppArrmor, so this profile needed to be deactivated. The AppArmor bug should be fixed when you have latest updates.

In /etc/default/tor comment out.

Then that profile will be load. Forgot to mention it.

You can see a bit more how /etc/init.d/tor works by running.

And more interestingly.
